metadata.title: CVE-2021-47012 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:RDMA/siw: Fix a use after free in siw_alloc_mrOur code analyzer reported a UAF.In siw_alloc_mr(), it calls siw_mr_add_mem(mr,..). In the implementation ofsiw_mr_add_mem(), mem is assigned to mr->mem and then mem is freed viakfree(mem) if xa_alloc_cyclic() failed. Here, mr->mem still point to afreed object. After, the execution continue up to the err_out branch ofsiw_alloc_mr, and the freed mr->mem is used in siw_mr_drop_mem(mr).My patch moves "mr->mem = mem" behind the if (xa_alloc_cyclic(..)<0) {}section, to avoid the uaf.
